intro: Ptychodon, commonly known as the false hellebore, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Ranunculaceae. It consists of several species that are native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. The plants typically have basal leaves that are palmately lobed or divided, and they produce showy, often yellow or white flowers. Ptychodon species are herbaceous perennials that thrive in moist, shaded environments. Their botanical features make them distinctive members of the Ranunculaceae family.
